title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 950.5 - General
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 950.5 - General

State Regulations
(a) No assemblages, parades or demonstrations of any kind shall be held in or upon any of the
buildings or the vehicular crossing without written permission from the
commission. (b) No person shall
damage, mark or deface any structure or appurtenance owned or under the control
of the commission. (c) Disabled
vehicles may be removed from the vehicular crossing by the commission. The
reasonable cost of such removal may be assessed by the commission against the
owner or operator thereof. (d) No
person shall transport or store in or upon the facilities any explosives or
other dangerous materials or articles unless permitted under section
950.6
of this Part. (e) Vehicles left unattended or any other
property abandoned in or upon the facilities may be removed by the
commission. (f) The use of the
facilities by any person or vehicle shall be deemed to be conditioned upon
payment of the tolls hereinbefore set forth and upon observance of the
foregoing rules and regulations. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
950.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
